Rulings.Edison:
●“This card Cannot be Special Summoned” is not treated as an effect.
●If you have no cards in your Deck when you activate the effect of “Witch of the Black Rose,” you will lose the Duel.
●If you activate the effect of “Witch of the Black Rose” while you have no cards in your hand and you draw “Infernity Archfiend,” you can activate the effect of “Infernity Archfiend.” You resolve the effect of “Witch of the Black Rose” like this: -Draw 1 card. If it is a monster, the effect is over. -If not, destroy “Witch of the Black Rose” and send the card drawn to the GY. (Destroying and sending the card occur at the same time.)

If it is a monster, the effect is over. -If not, destroy “Witch of the Black Rose” and send the card drawn to the GY. (Destroying and sending the card occur at the same time.)

Rulings.Base:
1. 'This card cannot be Special Summoned' is not treated as an effect.
2. If you have no cards in your Deck when you activate the effect of "Witch of the Black Rose", you will lose the Duel.
3. If you activate the effect of "Witch of the Black Rose" while you have no cards in your hand and you draw "Infernity Archfiend", you can activate the effect of "Infernity Archfiend".

This was an update to a previous ruling stating that Archfiend could activate normally. This updated pdf has since been removed from the official site, and replaced with the older version with the previous ruling. OCG database agrees with Archfiend being allowed to activate.
4. You resolve the effect of "Witch of the Black Rose" like this:
[*] Draw 1 card. If it is a monster, the effect is over.
[*] If not, destroy "Witch of the Black Rose" and send the card drawn to the GY. (Destroying and sending the card occur at the same time.)

PSCT.Base: Cannot be Special Summoned. If this card is Normal Summoned, and you control no other cards: Draw 1 card and show it, then, if it is not a monster, send it to the GY, also destroy this card.
